text: Jikirum Adjaluddin was a Filipino swimmer who competed at the 1932 and 1936 Summer Olympics. Adjaluddin was the only Southeast Asian to qualify for the semifinals of more than one event until the 2016 Summer Olympics when Singaporean Joseph Schooling and Quah Zheng Wen qualified for the semifinals in two events each. == Career == Jikirum Adjaluddin finished in 5th place at the 10th Olympic Games in Los Angeles, California in 1932. He made it to the finals of the Men’s 200m Breaststroke event. While at the 11th Olympic Games in Berlin, Germany in 1936, Jikirum Adjaluddin made it to the semifinal round of the Men’s 100m Free and 200m Breaststroke events where he finished 11th and 12th. ==References== Category:1919 births Category:1938 deaths Category:Filipino male swimmers Category:Swimmers at the 1932 Summer Olympics Category:Swimmers at the 1936 Summer Olympics Category:People from Sulu Category:Olympic swimmers of the Philippines Category:Filipino Muslims
title: Jikirum Adjaluddin
